column1: VT communities have pulled together to help their neighbors during the pandemic. But Vermonters need more help. The most effective way for Congress to help hungry Vermonters is to boost the proven #SNAP which is the best way to fight food insecurity across the country. #vtpoli https://t.co/9PviM5AHZd

Today I helped volunteers @UVHaven safely distribute turkeys to families in need. Thank you to all of the volunteers and everyone across the country who is helping their community get through these tough times. Have a safe and healthy Thanksgiving. #vtpoli https://t.co/eol5WQxaBz

On Transgender Day of Remembrance we remember those who have lost their lives due to transphobic violence the majority of whom are Black and Brown women. We must recommit ourselves to ending this crisis and fighting for the safety and dignity of all people. #TDOR2020 #vtpoli

Proud of VT for approving this legislation to help retail & other essential workers who have been going to work throughout the pandemic. They deserve our support. Congress must pass a stimulus that includes additional federal help for these workers across the country. #vtpoli https://t.co/gph6HKhmnY
If you don’t file taxes but still haven't received your COVID-19 stimulus check you have to apply by November 21. Use the IRS Non-Filer Tool to find out if you’re eligible: https://t.co/3Yp08TyWVY

Today I talked to @HungerFreeVT & #VT hunger councils about the urgent needs of Vermonters. As winter approaches & 1 in 4 Vermonters face food insecurity one thing is clear—Congress needs to pass another relief bill ASAP to provide more support for hungry Vermonters. #vtpoli

Spot on @JRosenworcel! This #EducationWeek we have to focus on the #HomeworkGap that is keeping so many kids from realizing their potential. In the midst of this pandemic it’s more important than ever to close the #DigitalDivide. #vtpoli https://t.co/iHaAI5yWbF

This evening the House passed a bill reauthorizing funding to continue the important work being done by the @uvmvermont Sea Grant Institute to preserve the ecosystems and enhance the economies of the Lake Champlain Basin. Keep up the great work! #vtpoli

.@realDonaldTrump lost. His refusal to concede is more than childish it’s dangerous. The threats against our nation grow every day but he ignores them. Denying the president-elect classified briefings & a normal transition jeopardizes the lives of our uniformed servicemembers.

Happy Veteran's Day. Today we honor the brave men & women who answered the call to duty & put their lives on the line in our country's service. Our veterans & their families are among the best our nation has to offer & we are forever indebted to your service & sacrifice. https://t.co/P4eHWCuU8I

While @realdonaldtrump tweets lies about the election his lawyers are fighting to take away American’s health insurance. Americans with preexisting conditions cannot go back to the dark ages before the ACA when they could not get insurance. The Supreme Court must uphold the law.

A shout out for @HigherGround and @gracepotter who joined me today to discuss my #SaveOurStages bill. Live music is more than just a show – it brings folks together and helps our local economies. This bill would help keep venues like Higher Ground open. #vtpoli https://t.co/MfXCOUKqw3

Congratulations President Biden! I am looking forward to working with you to deliver immediate COVID relief for Americans roll back the harmful Trump policies and enact meaningful legislation for working Americans.
Lies. https://t.co/sEpnAzWUBP
If you’re voting in person polls close tonight at 7pm in Vermont. #vtpoli

Grateful that Vermont has officials who work hard to make sure everyone can vote and all votes are counted! Be sure to give thanks to all the USPS employees poll workers and town clerks who are working so hard to ensure everyone’s voice is heard.

.@realdonaldtrump said that he will fire Dr. Fauci as soon as he can. Ignoring experts isn’t a strategy – it’s a dereliction of duty. I’ve introduced legislation to make sure that Fauci and other experts are protected. #vtpoli https://t.co/EEa46Y2kKb

I saw first-hand the consequences of Trump & @DHSGov’s family separation policy at the border. The devastation caused by their policy continues today as scores of children remain separated and may never be reunited with their parents.

Thank you to ANEW Place and everyone who made this possible. With winter fast approaching projects like this that provide Vermonters with an accessible and safe place to live while residents search for a permanent home are so important. #vtpoli https://t.co/du0Qtjvgop

Today I joined volunteers from @AgeWellVT to deliver meals to seniors in Franklin County. The work that these amazing volunteers do providing meals and companionship for seniors is more important than ever during this pandemic. Thank you! https://t.co/HcWsOE0QS0

I kicked off my morning @dfamilk St. Albans where they are upgrading their processing facility to make sure that Vermont farmers can efficiently sell their delicious dairy products in Vermont and across the nation. Thanks for the great work you do! https://t.co/APUgME8uMf
The calculated cruelty of the Trump administration’s family separation policy continues. The administration’s actions are shameful and inhumane.  https://t.co/Efrc7rNFmQ

Although I won’t be a special guest performing with the likes of Dave Matthews or Brittany Howard I’m proud to have been a lead player in getting this much needed legislation passed in the House.

I hope you can join us for the #SaveOurStages festival this weekend. Independent venues make our communities special but need federal help NOW to get through these challenging times. https://t.co/eULLNCPuGa
This is well deserved recognition for our nurses here in Vermont! Thank you to nurses everywhere for all that you do especially during this pandemic. https://t.co/4xwScQk6xJ

Celebrating #IndigenousPeoplesDay means we acknowledge our country’s real history and honor the contributions and sacrifices of Native American communities like the Abenaki here in Vermont.

VT is a leader in renewable energy/energy efficiency innovation & deployment. I’ve taken this VT approach w/ me to DC. This Energy Efficiency Day let’s focus on common sense. Energy efficiency saves money for individuals is good for jobs & the environment #EEDay2020

Big Pharma’s pricing strategy is focused on shareholder profits & executive compensation. Last week I was in D.C. to press Pharma CEOs on why their companies make Americans pay for their bonuses while they sell the same drugs to Canadians for less than 1/3 of the price here. https://t.co/buQdq1bokG
ICYMI here is what the American people lose out on. https://t.co/8laPmVo9Bt

Thank you to @Masks4Missions & @gracepotter! Today is #VTMaskDay & as we head into the fall & winter it’s imperative that we listen to the health experts & do our part. We are all in this together. Wear a mask & help save lives! https://t.co/MKrBZgkmvW
Our country is in crisis and inaction is hurting Americans. @senatemajldr must take up and pass the updated Heroes Act to deliver badly needed aid to communities across the country.
They provide needed relief for local restaurants & live venues. The pain of the pandemic is still being felt across Vermont and Leader McConnell needs to get off the sidelines and act. #vtpoli

Last night with my support the House passed an updated Heroes Act to deliver much needed Covid aid to communities across the country. In addition to the critical help for individuals and families the bill includes my RESTAURANTS Act and SOS Act. #vtpoli
I wish @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS and all Americans sick with Covid a full and speedy recovery.

Welcome home! I am so happy for Hazar and Hussam – a warm and generous couple who I had the pleasure to meet a few years ago in Rutland. We are so happy to call you Vermonters! #vtpoli https://t.co/QTb52uroAK
ICYMI: I hope you can join @RepKarenBass and me for this important discussion tonight. Head to my Facebook page at 5:30pm to tune in. https://t.co/iHgjEIPjDL

Today I’m back in DC to pass an updated Heroes Act. It includes badly need Covid relief including more than $15 billion in emergency broadband funding for families & students to make sure that they can connect for school work & doctors appointments. https://t.co/auCim2O4VJ
Wishing all those observing #YomKippur a meaningful fast.
I hope you can join @RepKarenBass and I for this important discussion. Please share your questions for us below. https://t.co/WnzPzr6SLb

This decision once again shines a light on the brutal injustice of our “justice” system. Breonna Taylor deserves justice for being gunned down in her home. This is not it. #JusticeForBreonnaTaylor

Proud to have voted last night for this deal to keep the government open stop USCIS furloughs and boost #3SquaresVT. We have more work to do in December and still badly need a Covid relief package but this deal avoids a shutdown now. #vtpoli https://t.co/9TTTkrmfRk
Peter issued the following statement on the death of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. https://t.co/Rtr1GYabrC

Thanks to the teachers and staff @WinooskiLearns for showing me the safe and nurturing environment they have created for their students. I am in awe of the teachers administrators students and parents who are trying to make back-to-school safe and successful this year! #vtpoli https://t.co/0O4tvJIrfE
I’m proud of the UVM student athletes. #BlackLivesMatter

September 11th is a raw and painful memory especially for those who lost loved ones on that horrible day. We will never forget the pain and loss but let us find hope in the unity and strength that brought us together and helped us through the aftermath of that brutal Tuesday. https://t.co/r3jqmFTQPK
Proud to have introduced this legislation. Thanks for fighting for our musicians and venues! https://t.co/ChzgKuiT7j

Now is not a time for half measures. According to a recent study 1 in 9 Vermonters were facing food insecurity before the pandemic. Now that number has skyrocketed to 1 in 4. The Senate vote on a ‘skinny’ package does nothing for them. It is cruel and wrong.

Today we reflect & honor the work that was done to ensure equal access to the ballot box for more Americans. That work continues. We cannot rest until every American can vote without regard to their gender skin color or what neighborhood they live in. #vtpoli #WomensVote100

Voting is the foundation of our democracy. Today we celebrate 100 years of the #19th Amendment which for the first time guaranteed women the right to vote—though women of color continued to face many barriers.
I look forward to finding a permanent solution to protect these workers and improve our immigration system.
After the House passed a bill that I cosponsored to stave off furloughs @USCIS I am pleased to announce that they have abandoned their plans to furlough more than 13k employees including 1100 VTers.

The 7 shots callously fired into Jacob Blake’s back are more proof of a society that systemically brutally & repeatedly harms Black people. We need more than an independent investigation we need to build a better society that values the lives of Black people. #BlackLivesMatter

With millions expected to vote by mail this November and many Americans getting their medicine or unemployment check by mail during this pandemic this bill will make sure that the Postal Service has the funds and the support it needs to deliver the mail on time.
I just voted YES on legislation to protect the U.S. Postal Service. #DontMessWithUSPS.

America's long journey to achieve MLK's dream where a person is not judged by the color of his skin but the content of his character is under assault. But the memory of Dr. Martin Luther King sustains me and I think millions of Americans. #MLKDay

While the victim of violence he spoke of love. While the road ahead was long and arduous he spoke of hope and commitment. While he worked in a hostile South surrounded by people who wished him harm he spoke of forgiveness. #MLKDay

Before the annual gathering we all attended church at the Ebenezer Baptist Church where MLK was the pastor. I don’t remember his exact words but I remember like it was yesterday how his words stirred me. #MLKDay

In the summer of 1967 I was working with a community organization on the West Side of Chicago. In August I traveled with a group of young people to Atlanta to attend the annual convention of Dr. King’s Southern Christian Leadership Conference. #MLKDay https://t.co/Sty2b92rsx
